create.name: Create
create.description: Shows a notification on the **Notifications** panel.

notification_id.name: Notification ID
notification_id.description: ID of the notification. This new notification will overwrite an existing notification with the same ID.

dismiss.name: Dismiss
dismiss.description: Removes a notification from the **Notifications** panel.

notification_id.name: Notification ID
notification_id.description: ID of the notification to be removed.

dismiss_all.name: Dismiss all
dismiss_all.description: Removes all notifications from the **Notifications** panel.

save_persistent_states.name: Save persistent states
save_persistent_states.description: Saves the persistent states immediately. Maintains the normal periodic saving interval.

turn_off.name: Generic turn off
turn_off.description: Generic service to turn devices off under any domain.

turn_on.name: Generic turn on
turn_on.description: Generic service to turn devices on under any domain.

toggle.name: Generic toggle
toggle.description: Generic service to toggle devices on/off under any domain.

check_config.name: Check configuration
check_config.description: Checks the Home Assistant YAML-configuration files for errors. Errors will be shown in the Home Assistant logs.

update_entity.name: Update entity
update_entity.description: Forces one or more entities to update its data.

reload_core_config.name: Reload core configuration
reload_core_config.description: Reloads the core configuration from the YAML-configuration.

reload_custom_templates.name: Reload custom Jinja2 templates
reload_custom_templates.description: Reloads Jinja2 templates found in the `custom_templates` folder in your config. New values will be applied on the next render of the template.

entry_id.name: Config entry ID
entry_id.description: The configuration entry ID of the entry to be reloaded.

reload_all.name: Reload all
reload_all.description: Reload all YAML configuration that can be reloaded without restarting Home Assistant.

add_device_to_area.name: Add a device to an area 👻
add_device_to_area.description: Adds an device to an area. Please note, if the device is already in an area, it will be removed from the previous area.

area_id.name: Area ID
area_id.description: The ID of the area to add the device to.

device_id.name: Device ID
device_id.description: The ID of the device(s) to add to the area.

delete_all_orphaned_entities.name: Delete all orphaned entities 👻
delete_all_orphaned_entities.description:
Deletes all orphaned entities that no longer have an integration that claim/provide them. Please note, if the integration was just removed, it might need a restart for Home Assistant to realize they are orphaned.
**WARNING** Entities might have been marked orphaned because an integration is offline or not working since Home Assistant started. Calling this service will delete those entities as well.

remove_device_from_area.name: Remove a device from an area 👻
remove_device_from_area.description: Removes a device from an area. As a device can only be in one area, this call doesn't need to specify the area.

device_id.name: Device ID
device_id.description: The ID of the device to remove the area from.

add_entity_to_area.name: Add an entity to an area 👻
add_entity_to_area.description: Adds an entity to an area. Please note, if the enity is already in an area, it will be removed from the previous area. This will override the area the device, that provides this entity, is in.

area_id.name: Area ID
area_id.description: The ID of the area to add the entity to.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: The ID of the entity (or entities) to add to the area.

delete_area.name: Delete an area 👻
delete_area.description: Deletes a new area on the fly.

area_id.name: Area ID
area_id.description: The ID of the area to delete.

enable_entity.name: Enable an entity 👻
enable_entity.description: Enables an entity (or entities) on the fly.

entity_id.name: Entity
entity_id.description: The entity/entities to enable.

update_entity_id.name: Update an entity's ID 👻
update_entity_id.description: Updates an entity's ID on the fly.

entity_id.name: Entity
entity_id.description: The entity/entities to update.

new_entity_id.name: New Entity ID
new_entity_id.description: The new ID for the entity

disable_entity.name: Disable an entity 👻
disable_entity.description: Disables an entity (or entities) on the fly.

entity_id.name: Entity
entity_id.description: The entity/entities to disable.

unhide_entity.name: Unhide an entity 👻
unhide_entity.description: Unhides an entity (or entities) on the fly.

entity_id.name: Entity
entity_id.description: The entity/entities to unhide.

config_entry_id.name: Config entry
config_entry_id.description: The integration configuration entry to enable.

safe_mode.name: Safe mode
safe_mode.description: If the restart should be done in safe mode. This will disable all custom integrations and frontend modules.

force.name: Force restart
force.description: Force the restart. WARNING! This will not gracefully shutdown Home Assistant, it will skip configuration checks and ignore running database migrations. Only use this if you know what you are doing.

add_alias_to_area.name: Add an alias to an area 👻
add_alias_to_area.description: Adds an alias to an area.

area_id.name: Area ID
area_id.description: The ID of the area to add the alias to.

alias.name: Alias
alias.description: The alias (or list of aliasses) to add to the area.

set_area_aliases.name: Sets aliases for an area 👻
set_area_aliases.description: Sets aliases for an area. Overwrite and removed any existing aliases, fully replacing them with the new ones.

area_id.name: Area ID
area_id.description: The ID of the area to set the aliases for.

aliases.name: Aliases
aliases.description: The aliases to set for the area.

disable_polling.name: Disable polling for updates 👻
disable_polling.description: Disables polling for updates for an integration configuration entry.

config_entry_id.name: Config entry
config_entry_id.description: The integration configuration entry to disable polling for.

disable_device.name: Disable a device 👻
disable_device.description: Disables a device on the fly.

remove_entity_from_area.name: Remove an entity from an area 👻
remove_entity_from_area.description: Removes an entity from an area. As an entity can only be in one area, this call doesn't need to specify the area. Please note, the entity will still be in the area of the device that provides it after this call.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: The ID of the entity (or entities) to remove the area from.

enable_device.name: Enable a device 👻
enable_device.description: Enables a device on the fly.

config_entry_id.name: Config entry
config_entry_id.description: The integration configuration entry to disable.

remove_alias_from_area.name: Remove an alias from an area 👻
remove_alias_from_area.description: Removes an alias from an area.

area_id.name: Area ID
area_id.description: The ID of the area to remove the alias from.

alias.name: Alias
alias.description: The alias (or list of aliasses) to remove from the area.

hide_entity.name: Hide an entity 👻
hide_entity.description: Hides an entity (or entities) on the fly.

entity_id.name: Entity
entity_id.description: The entity/entities to hide.

create_area.name: Create an area 👻
create_area.description: Creates a new area on the fly.

name.name: Name
name.description: The name of the area to create.

aliases.name: Aliases
aliases.description: A list of aliases for the area. This is useful if you want to use the area in a different language or different nickname.

ignore_all_discovered.name: Ignore all currently discovered devices 👻
ignore_all_discovered.description: Ignore all currently discovered devices that are shown on the integrations dashboard. This will not ignore devices that are discovered after this.

domain.name: Integration domain
domain.description: The integration domain to ignore all discovered devices for. If not provided, all domains will be considered to be ignored.

enable_polling.name: Enable polling for updates 👻
enable_polling.description: Enables polling for updates for an integration configuration entry.

config_entry_id.name: Config entry
config_entry_id.description: The integration configuration entry to enable polling for.

logger.name: Logger
logger.description: Logger name under which to log the message. Defaults to `system_log.external`.

set_default_level.name: Set default level
set_default_level.description: Sets the default log level for integrations.

level.name: Level
level.description: Default severity level for all integrations.

set_level.name: Set level
set_level.description: Sets the log level for one or more integrations.

reload_resources.name: Reload resources
reload_resources.description: Reloads dashboard resources from the YAML-configuration.

remove_device_tracker.name: Remove a device tracker 👻
remove_device_tracker.description: Remove a device tracker from a person.

entity_id.name: Person
entity_id.description: The person entity ID to remove the device tracker from.

device_tracker.name: Device tracker
device_tracker.description: The device tracker entity ID to remove from the person.

add_device_tracker.name: Add a device tracker 👻
add_device_tracker.description: Add a device tracker to a person.

entity_id.name: Person
entity_id.description: The person entity ID to add the device tracker to.

device_tracker.name: Device tracker
device_tracker.description: The device tracker entity ID to add to the person.

set_theme.name: Set the default theme
set_theme.description: Sets the default theme Home Assistant uses. Can be overridden by a user.

purge.name: Purge
purge.description: Starts purge task - to clean up old data from your database.

keep_days.name: Days to keep
keep_days.description: Number of days to keep the data in the database. Starting today, counting backward. A value of `7` means that everything older than a week will be purged.

repack.name: Repack
repack.description: Attempt to save disk space by rewriting the entire database file.

apply_filter.name: Apply filter
apply_filter.description: Apply `entity_id` and `event_type` filters in addition to time-based purge.

purge_entities.name: Purge entities
purge_entities.description: Starts a purge task to remove the data related to specific entities from your database.

domains.name: Domains to remove
domains.description: List of domains for which the data needs to be removed from the recorder database.

entity_globs.name: Entity globs to remove
entity_globs.description: List of glob patterns used to select the entities for which the data is to be removed from the recorder database.

keep_days.name: Days to keep
keep_days.description: Number of days to keep the data for rows matching the filter. Starting today, counting backward. A value of `7` means that everything older than a week will be purged. The default of 0 days will remove all matching rows immediately.

enable.name: Enable
enable.description: Starts the recording of events and state changes.

disable.name: Disable
disable.description: Stops the recording of events and state changes.

statistic_id.name: Statistics ID
statistic_id.description: The statistics ID (entity ID) to import for.

source.name: Source
source.description: The source of the statistics data.

unit_of_measurement.name: Unit of measurement
unit_of_measurement.description: The unit of measurement of the statistics.

has_mean.name: Has a mean
has_mean.description: If the statistics has a mean value.

has_sum.name: Has a sum
has_sum.description: If the statistics has a sum value.

stats.name: Statistics
stats.description: A list of mappings/dictionaries with statistics to import. The dictionaries must contain a "start" key with a datetime string other valid options are "mean", "sum", "min", "max", "last_reset", and "state". All of those are optional and either an integer or a float, except for "last_reset" which is a datetime string.

remote_connect.name: Remote connect
remote_connect.description: Makes the instance UI accessible from outside of the local network by using Home Assistant Cloud.

remote_disconnect.name: Remote disconnect
remote_disconnect.description: Disconnects the Home Assistant UI from the Home Assistant Cloud. You will no longer be able to access your Home Assistant instance from outside your local network.

reload.name: Reload
reload.description: Reloads the scenes from the YAML-configuration.

entities.name: Entities state
entities.description: List of entities and their target state.

transition.name: Transition
transition.description: Time it takes the devices to transition into the states defined in the scene.

scene_id.name: Scene entity ID
scene_id.description: The entity ID of the new scene.

entities.name: Entities state
entities.description: List of entities and their target state. If your entities are already in the target state right now, use `snapshot_entities` instead.

snapshot_entities.name: Snapshot entities
snapshot_entities.description: List of entities to be included in the snapshot. By taking a snapshot, you record the current state of those entities. If you do not want to use the current state of all your entities for this scene, you can combine the `snapshot_entities` with `entities`.

transition.name: Transition
transition.description: Time it takes the devices to transition into the states defined in the scene.

reload.description: Reload localtuya and reconnect to all devices.

set_dp.description: Change the value of a datapoint (DP)

device_id.description: Device ID of device to change datapoint value for

process.name: Process
process.description: Launches a conversation from a transcribed text.

language.name: Language
language.description: Language of text. Defaults to server language.

agent_id.name: Agent
agent_id.description: Conversation agent to process your request. The conversation agent is the brains of your assistant. It processes the incoming text commands.

conversation_id.name: Conversation ID
conversation_id.description: ID of the conversation, to be able to continue a previous conversation

language.name: Language
language.description: Language to clear cached intents for. Defaults to server language.

reload.name: Reload
reload.description: Reloads group configuration, entities, and notify services from YAML-configuration.

object_id.name: Object ID
object_id.description: Object ID of this group. This object ID is used as part of the entity ID. Entity ID format: [domain].[object_id].

icon.name: Icon
icon.description: Name of the icon for the group.

entities.name: Entities
entities.description: List of all members in the group. Cannot be used in combination with `Add entities` or `Remove entities`.

add_entities.name: Add entities
add_entities.description: List of members to be added to the group. Cannot be used in combination with `Entities` or `Remove entities`.

remove_entities.name: Remove entities
remove_entities.description: List of members to be removed from a group. Cannot be used in combination with `Entities` or `Add entities`.

all.name: All
all.description: Enable this option if the group should only be used when all entities are in state `on`.

object_id.name: Object ID
object_id.description: Object ID of this group. This object ID is used as part of the entity ID. Entity ID format: [domain].[object_id].

summary.name: Summary
summary.description: Defines the short summary or subject for the event.

description.example: Meeting to provide technical review for 'Phoenix' design.
description.name: Description
description.description: A more complete description of the event than the one provided by the summary.

start_date_time.name: Start time
start_date_time.description: The date and time the event should start.

end_date_time.name: End time
end_date_time.description: The date and time the event should end.

start_date.name: Start date
start_date.description: The date the all-day event should start.

end_date.name: End date
end_date.description: The date the all-day event should end (exclusive).

in.name: In
in.description: Days or weeks that you want to create the event in.

list_events.name: List event
list_events.description: Lists events on a calendar within a time range.

start_date_time.name: Start time
start_date_time.description: Returns active events after this time (exclusive). When not set, defaults to now.

end_date_time.name: End time
end_date_time.description: Returns active events before this time (exclusive). Cannot be used with 'duration'.

duration.name: Duration
duration.description: Returns active events from start_date_time until the specified duration.

get_events.name: Get events
get_events.description: Get events on a calendar within a time range.

start_date_time.name: Start time
start_date_time.description: Returns active events after this time (exclusive). When not set, defaults to now.

end_date_time.name: End time
end_date_time.description: Returns active events before this time (exclusive). Cannot be used with 'duration'.

duration.name: Duration
duration.description: Returns active events from start_date_time until the specified duration.

bridge_delete_callback.name: Delete callback URL from Bridge callbacks list
bridge_delete_callback.description: The callbacks currently set are exposed as attributes of the 'Bridge Callback Set' entity

execute_action.name: Execute arbitrary lock action via the Bridge or Web API

send_magic_packet.name: Send magic packet
send_magic_packet.description: Sends a 'magic packet' to wake up a device with 'Wake-On-LAN' capabilities.

mac.name: MAC address
mac.description: MAC address of the device to wake up.

broadcast_address.name: Broadcast address
broadcast_address.description: Broadcast IP where to send the magic packet.

broadcast_port.name: Broadcast port
broadcast_port.description: Port where to send the magic packet.

log.name: Log
log.description: Creates a custom entry in the logbook.

name.name: Name
name.description: Custom name for an entity, can be referenced using an `entity_id`.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity to reference in the logbook entry.

domain.name: Domain
domain.description: Determines which icon is used in the logbook entry. The icon illustrates the integration domain related to this logbook entry.

cycle.name: Cycle
cycle.description: If the option should cycle from the last to the first.

cycle.name: Cycle
cycle.description: If the option should cycle from the first to the last.

random.name: Select random option 👻
random.description: Select an random option for a select entity.

options.name: Options
options.description: Limits the options to select from. If not provided, all options will be considered.

create_link.name: Create Link
create_link.description: Create a temporary or permanent link to a stream (enter "url" or "entity")

link_id.description: Create a random or permanent ID for your link

open_limit.description: How many times a link can be opened (0 - unlimit)

time_to_live.description: How many seconds will the link live (0 - unlimit)

dash_cast.name: DashCast
dash_cast.description: Cast stream to Chromecast device via DashCast application

entity_id.description: Media player entity

set_value.name: Set
set_value.description: Sets the value of a number.

max.name: Set maximum value 👻
max.description: Set a number entity to its maximum value.

decrement.name: Decrease value 👻
decrement.description: Decrease a number entity value by a certain amount.

amount.name: Amount
amount.description: The amount to decrease the number with. If not provided, the step of the number entity will be used.

min.name: Set minimum value 👻
min.description: Set a number entity to its minimum value.

increment.name: Increase value 👻
increment.description: Increase a number entity value by a certain amount.

amount.name: Amount
amount.description: The amount to increase the number with. If not provided, the step of the number entity will be used.

get.name: Get
get.description: Fetches data for a single species

species.name: Species
species.description: The name of the species exactly as written in "pid" or "scientific species" in Openplantbook

clean_cache.name: Clean Cache
clean_cache.description: Clean up the cached entries from Openplantbook

hours.name: Hours
hours.description: Minimum age of entries to clean from the cache. Default to 24 hours if not set

start.name: Start
start.description: Sends a start command to a ffmpeg based sensor.

entity_id.name: Entity
entity_id.description: Name of entity that will start. Platform dependent.

stop.name: Stop
stop.description: Sends a stop command to a ffmpeg based sensor.

entity_id.name: Entity
entity_id.description: Name of entity that will stop. Platform dependent.

restart.name: Restart
restart.description: Sends a restart command to a ffmpeg based sensor.

entity_id.name: Entity
entity_id.description: Name of entity that will restart. Platform dependent.

duration.name: Duration
duration.description: Duration the timer requires to finish. [optional].

duration.name: Duration
duration.description: Duration to add or subtract to the running timer.

set_duration.name: Set duration 👻
set_duration.description: Set duration for an existing timer.

duration.name: Duration
duration.description: New duration for the timer, as a timedelta string.

ourphones.name: Send a notification with ourphones
ourphones.description: Sends a notification message using the ourphones service.

message.example: The garage door has been open for 10 minutes.

persistent_notification.name: Send a persistent notification
persistent_notification.description: Sends a notification that is visible in the **Notifications** panel.

message.example: The garage door has been open for 10 minutes.
message.name: Message

data.name: Data
data.description: Some integrations provide extended functionality. For information on how to use _data_, refer to the integration documentation..

mobile_app_iphone_philipp.name: Send a notification via mobile_app_iphone_philipp
mobile_app_iphone_philipp.description: Sends a notification message using the mobile_app_iphone_philipp integration.

message.example: The garage door has been open for 10 minutes.

mobile_app_fantenphone.name: Send a notification via mobile_app_fantenphone
mobile_app_fantenphone.description: Sends a notification message using the mobile_app_fantenphone integration.

message.example: The garage door has been open for 10 minutes.

notify.name: Send a notification with notify
notify.description: Sends a notification message using the notify service.

message.example: The garage door has been open for 10 minutes.

o365_email_philipp.name: Send a notification via o365_email_philipp
o365_email_philipp.description: Sends a notification message using the o365_email_philipp integration.

message.example: The garage door has been open for 10 minutes.

turn_on.name: Turn on
turn_on.description: Runs the sequence of actions defined in a script.

toggle.name: Toggle
toggle.description: Toggle a script. Starts it, if isn't running, stops it otherwise.

trigger.name: Trigger
trigger.description: Triggers the actions of an automation.

skip_condition.name: Skip conditions
skip_condition.description: Defines whether or not the conditions will be skipped.

timestamp.name: Timestamp
timestamp.description: The target date & time, expressed by a UNIX timestamp.

press.name: Press
press.description: Mimics the physical button press on the device.

register_service.description: Register a new service for netdaemon, used by the daemon and not to be used by users

service.description: The name of the service to register

class.description: The class that implements the service call

entity_id.description: The entity ID of the entity

unit.description: The unit of measurement for the entity

options.description: List of options for a select entity

entity_id.description: The entity ID of the entity

unit.description: The unit of measurement for the entity

options.description: List of options for a select entity

entity_id.description: The entity ID of the entity

toggle.name: Toggle
toggle.description: Toggles climate device, from on to off, or off to on.

activity.name: Activity
activity.description: Activity ID or activity name to be started.

send_command.name: Send command
send_command.description: Sends a command or a list of commands to a device.

device.name: Device
device.description: Device ID to send command to.

command.name: Command
command.description: A single command or a list of commands to send.

num_repeats.name: Repeats
num_repeats.description: The number of times you want to repeat the commands.

delay_secs.name: Delay seconds
delay_secs.description: The time you want to wait in between repeated commands.

hold_secs.name: Hold seconds
hold_secs.description: The time you want to have it held before the release is send.

learn_command.name: Learn command
learn_command.description: Learns a command or a list of commands from a device.

device.name: Device
device.description: Device ID to learn command from.

command.name: Command
command.description: A single command or a list of commands to learn.

command_type.name: Command type
command_type.description: The type of command to be learned.

alternative.name: Alternative
alternative.description: If code must be stored as an alternative. This is useful for discrete codes. Discrete codes are used for toggles that only perform one function. For example, a code to only turn a device on. If it is on already, sending the code won't change the state.

timeout.name: Timeout
timeout.description: Timeout for the command to be learned.

delete_command.name: Delete command
delete_command.description: Deletes a command or a list of commands from the database.

device.name: Device
device.description: Device from which commands will be deleted.

command.name: Command
command.description: The single command or the list of commands to be deleted.

reload.name: Reload
reload.description: Reloads template entities from the YAML-configuration.

value.name: Value
value.description: The new counter value the entity should be set to.

publish.name: Publish
publish.description: Publishes a message to an MQTT topic.

payload_template.name: Payload template
payload_template.description: Template to render as a payload value. If a payload is provided, the template is ignored.

qos.name: QoS
qos.description: Quality of Service to use. 0: At most once. 1: At least once. 2: Exactly once.

retain.name: Retain
retain.description: If the message should have the retain flag set. If set, the broker stores the most recent message on a topic.

dump.name: Export
dump.description: Writes all messages on a specific topic into the `mqtt_dump.txt` file in your configuration folder.

duration.name: Duration
duration.description: How long we should listen for messages in seconds.

reload.name: Reload
reload.description: Reloads MQTT entities from the YAML-configuration.

content.name: Content
content.description: Popup content (Test or lovelace card configuration)

right_button_action.name: Right button action
right_button_action.description: Action to perform when the right button is pressed

left_button_action.name: Left button action
left_button_action.description: Action to perform when left button is pressed

dismissable.name: User dismissable
dismissable.description: Whether the popup can be closed by the user without action

dismiss_action.name: Dismiss action
dismiss_action.description: Action to perform when popup is dismissed

autoclose.name: Auto close
autoclose.description: Close the popup automatically on mouse, pointer or keyboard activity

timeout_action.name: Timeout action
timeout_action.description: Action to perform when popup is closed by timeout

style.name: Styles
style.description: CSS code to apply to the popup window

action.name: Button action
action.description: Action to perform when the action button is pressed

navigate.description: Navigate browser to a different page

alarm_arm_home.name: Arm home
alarm_arm_home.description: Sets the alarm to: _armed, but someone is home_.

alarm_arm_away.name: Arm away
alarm_arm_away.description: Sets the alarm to: _armed, no one home_.

alarm_arm_night.name: Arm night
alarm_arm_night.description: Sets the alarm to: _armed for the night_.

alarm_arm_vacation.name: Arm vacation
alarm_arm_vacation.description: Sets the alarm to: _armed for vacation_.

alarm_arm_custom_bypass.name: Arm with custom bypass
alarm_arm_custom_bypass.description: Arms the alarm while allowing to bypass a custom area.

set_cover_position.name: Set position
set_cover_position.description: Moves a cover to a specific position.

set_cover_tilt_position.name: Set tilt position
set_cover_tilt_position.description: Moves a cover tilt to a specific position.

increase_speed.name: Increase speed
increase_speed.description: Increases the speed of the fan.

percentage_step.name: Increment
percentage_step.description: Increases the speed by a percentage step.

decrease_speed.name: Decrease speed
decrease_speed.description: Decreases the speed of the fan.

percentage_step.name: Decrement
percentage_step.description: Decreases the speed by a percentage step.

mode.name: Mode
mode.description: Operation mode. For example, _normal_, _eco_, or _away_. For a list of possible values, refer to the integration documentation.

dock.name: Return to dock
dock.description: Stops the mowing task and returns to the dock.

code.name: Code
code.description: Code used to unlock the lock.

code.name: Code
code.description: Code used to lock the lock.

code.name: Code
code.description: Code used to open the lock.

tone.name: Tone
tone.description: The tone to emit. When `available_tones` property is a map, either the key or the value can be used. Must be supported by the integration.

volume_level.name: Volume
volume_level.description: The volume. 0 is inaudible, 1 is the maximum volume. Must be supported by the integration.

duration.name: Duration
duration.description: Number of seconds the sound is played. Must be supported by the integration.

install.name: Install update
install.description: Installs an update for this device or service.

version.name: Version
version.description: The version to install. If omitted, the latest version will be installed.

backup.name: Backup
backup.description: If supported by the integration, this creates a backup before starting the update .

skip.name: Skip update
skip.description: Marks currently available update as skipped.

clear_skipped.name: Clear skipped update
clear_skipped.description: Removes the skipped version marker from an update.

start.name: Start
start.description: Starts or resumes the cleaning task.

return_to_base.name: Return to dock
return_to_base.description: Tells the vacuum cleaner to return to its dock.

clean_spot.name: Clean spot
clean_spot.description: Tells the vacuum cleaner to do a spot clean-up.

set_fan_speed.name: Set fan speed
set_fan_speed.description: Sets the fan speed of the vacuum cleaner.

fan_speed.name: Fan speed
fan_speed.description: Fan speed. The value depends on the integration. Some integrations have speed steps, like 'medium'. Some use a percentage, between 0 and 100.

send_command.name: Send command
send_command.description: Sends a command to the vacuum cleaner.

command.name: Command
command.description: Command to execute. The commands are integration-specific.

params.name: Parameters
params.description: Parameters for the command. The parameters are integration-specific.

set_valve_position.name: Set position
set_valve_position.description: Moves a valve to a specific position.

temperature.name: Temperature
temperature.description: New target temperature for the water heater.

operation_mode.name: Operation mode
operation_mode.description: New value of the operation mode. For a list of possible modes, refer to the integration documentation.

operation_mode.name: Operation mode
operation_mode.description: New value of the operation mode. For a list of possible modes, refer to the integration documentation.

speak.name: Speak
speak.description: Speaks something using text-to-speech on a media player.

media_player_entity_id.name: Media player entity
media_player_entity_id.description: Media players to play the message.

message.name: Message
message.description: The text you want to convert into speech so that you can listen to it on your device.

cache.name: Cache
cache.description: Stores this message locally so that when the text is requested again, the output can be produced more quickly.

language.name: Language
language.description: Language to use for speech generation.

clear_cache.name: Clear TTS cache
clear_cache.description: Removes all cached text-to-speech files and purges the memory.

cloud_say.name: Say a TTS message with cloud
cloud_say.description: Say something using text-to-speech on a media player with cloud.

max.name: Set maximum value 👻
max.description: Set an input number entity to its maximum value.

decrement.name: Decrease value 👻
decrement.description: Decrease an input number entity value by a certain amount.

amount.name: Amount
amount.description: The amount to decrease the input number with. If not provided, the step of the number entity will be used.

min.name: Set minimum value 👻
min.description: Set an input number entity to its minimum value.

increment.name: Increase value 👻
increment.description: Increase an input number entity value by a certain amount.

amount.name: Amount
amount.description: The amount to increase the input number with. If not provided, the step of the number entity will be used.

cycle.name: Cycle
cycle.description: If the option should cycle from the last to the first option on the list.

cycle.name: Cycle
cycle.description: If the option should cycle from the last to the first option on the list.

shuffle.name: Shuffle options 👻
shuffle.description: Shuffles the list of selectable options for an `input_select` entity. This is not persistent and will be undone once reloaded or Home Assistant restarts.

random.name: Select random option 👻
random.description: Select an random option for an input_select entity.

options.name: Options
options.description: Limits the options to select from. If not provided, all options will be considered.

sort.name: Sort options 👻
sort.description: Sorts the list of selectable options for an `input_select` entity. This is not persistent and will be undone once reloaded or Home Assistant restarts.

turn_on.name: Turn on
turn_on.description: Turn on one or more lights and adjust properties of the light, even when they are turned on already.

transition.name: Transition
transition.description: Duration it takes to get to next state.

rgb_color.name: Color
rgb_color.description: The color in RGB format. A list of three integers between 0 and 255 representing the values of red, green, and blue.

rgbw_color.name: RGBW-color
rgbw_color.description: The color in RGBW format. A list of four integers between 0 and 255 representing the values of red, green, blue, and white.

rgbww_color.name: RGBWW-color
rgbww_color.description: The color in RGBWW format. A list of five integers between 0 and 255 representing the values of red, green, blue, cold white, and warm white.

hs_color.name: Hue/Sat color
hs_color.description: Color in hue/sat format. A list of two integers. Hue is 0-360 and Sat is 0-100.

xy_color.name: XY-color
xy_color.description: Color in XY-format. A list of two decimal numbers between 0 and 1.

brightness.name: Brightness value
brightness.description: Number indicating brightness, where 0 turns the light off, 1 is the minimum brightness, and 255 is the maximum brightness.

brightness_pct.name: Brightness
brightness_pct.description: Number indicating the percentage of full brightness, where 0 turns the light off, 1 is the minimum brightness, and 100 is the maximum brightness.

white.name: White
white.description: Set the light to white mode.

profile.name: Profile
profile.description: Name of a light profile to use.

flash.name: Flash
flash.description: Tell light to flash, can be either value short or long.

turn_off.name: Turn off
turn_off.description: Turn off one or more lights.

transition.name: Transition
transition.description: Duration it takes to get to next state.

flash.name: Flash
flash.description: Tell light to flash, can be either value short or long.

toggle.name: Toggle
toggle.description: Toggles one or more lights, from on to off, or, off to on, based on their current state.

transition.name: Transition
transition.description: Duration it takes to get to next state.

rgb_color.name: Color
rgb_color.description: The color in RGB format. A list of three integers between 0 and 255 representing the values of red, green, and blue.

hs_color.name: Hue/Sat color
hs_color.description: Color in hue/sat format. A list of two integers. Hue is 0-360 and Sat is 0-100.

xy_color.name: XY-color
xy_color.description: Color in XY-format. A list of two decimal numbers between 0 and 1.

brightness.name: Brightness value
brightness.description: Number indicating brightness, where 0 turns the light off, 1 is the minimum brightness, and 255 is the maximum brightness.

brightness_pct.name: Brightness
brightness_pct.description: Number indicating the percentage of full brightness, where 0 turns the light off, 1 is the minimum brightness, and 100 is the maximum brightness.

white.name: White
white.description: Set the light to white mode.

profile.name: Profile
profile.description: Name of a light profile to use.

flash.name: Flash
flash.description: Tell light to flash, can be either value short or long.

turn_on.name: Turn on
turn_on.description: Turns on the power of the media player.

turn_off.name: Turn off
turn_off.description: Turns off the power of the media player.

volume_level.name: Level
volume_level.description: The volume. 0 is inaudible, 1 is the maximum volume.

volume_mute.name: Mute/unmute volume
volume_mute.description: Mutes or unmutes the media player.

is_volume_muted.name: Muted
is_volume_muted.description: Defines whether or not it is muted.

media_seek.name: Seek
media_seek.description: Allows you to go to a different part of the media that is currently playing.

seek_position.name: Position
seek_position.description: Target position in the currently playing media. The format is platform dependent.

join.name: Join
join.description: Groups media players together for synchronous playback. Only works on supported multiroom audio systems.

group_members.name: Group members
group_members.description: The players which will be synced with the playback specified in `target`.

select_source.name: Select source
select_source.description: Sends the media player the command to change input source.

source.name: Source
source.description: Name of the source to switch to. Platform dependent.

sound_mode.name: Sound mode
sound_mode.description: Name of the sound mode to switch to.

media_content_id.name: Content ID
media_content_id.description: The ID of the content to play. Platform dependent.

media_content_type.name: Content type
media_content_type.description: The type of the content to play. Such as image, music, tv show, video, episode, channel, or playlist.

enqueue.name: Enqueue
enqueue.description: If the content should be played now or be added to the queue.

announce.name: Announce
announce.description: If the media should be played as an announcement.

shuffle_set.name: Shuffle
shuffle_set.description: Playback mode that selects the media in randomized order.

shuffle.name: Shuffle
shuffle.description: Whether or not shuffle mode is enabled.

unjoin.name: Unjoin
unjoin.description: Removes the player from a group. Only works on platforms which support player groups.

repeat_set.name: Repeat
repeat_set.description: Playback mode that plays the media in a loop.

update.name: Update a zone 👻
update.description: Update properties of a zone on the fly.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: The ID of the entity (or entities) to update.

icon.name: Icon
icon.description: Icon to use for the zone

delete.name: Delete a zone 👻
delete.description: Delete a zone. This works only with zones created and managed via the UI. Zones created and managed in YAML cannot be managed by Spook.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: The ID of the entity (or entities) to remove.

create.name: Create a zone 👻
create.description: Create a new zone in Home Assistant on the fly.

icon.name: Icon
icon.description: Icon to use for the zone

snapshot.name: Take snapshot
snapshot.description: Takes a snapshot from a camera.

filename.name: Filename
filename.description: Template of a filename. Variable available is `entity_id`.

play_stream.name: Play stream
play_stream.description: Plays the camera stream on a supported media player.

format.name: Format
format.description: Stream format supported by the media player.

record.name: Record
record.description: Creates a recording of a live camera feed.

filename.name: Filename
filename.description: Template of a filename. Variable available is `entity_id`. Must be mp4.

duration.name: Duration
duration.description: Planned duration of the recording. The actual duration may vary.

lookback.name: Lookback
lookback.description: Planned lookback period to include in the recording (in addition to the duration). Only available if there is currently an active HLS stream. The actual length of the lookback period may vary.

type.name: Forecast type
type.description: Forecast type: daily, hourly or twice daily.

type.name: Forecast type
type.description: Forecast type: daily, hourly or twice daily.

replace_sensor.name: Replace sensor
replace_sensor.description: Replaces the source for a plant sensor.

meter_entity.name: Meter entity
meter_entity.description: The meter entity to replace the sensor for.

new_sensor.name: Sensor entity
new_sensor.description: Entity id of the new sensor. Leave blank to remove sensor.

trigger_scenario.name: Trigger Scenario
trigger_scenario.description: Triggers a scenario on Bosch SHC.

name.name: Scenario name
name.description: Name of the scenario to trigger

trigger_rawscan.name: Trigger Rawscan
trigger_rawscan.description: Triggers a rawscan on Bosch SHC to discover devices. Result streamed to info logger.

command.name: Rawscan command
command.description: Rawscan command to trigger. Possible commands are 'devices', 'device', 'services', 'device_services', 'device_service', 'rooms', 'scenarios', 'info', 'information', 'public_information', 'intrusion_detection'

device_id.name: Device id
device_id.description: Device id in case the command is 'device', 'device_services' or 'device_service'

service_id.name: Service id
service_id.description: Service id in case the command is 'device_service'

smokedetector_check.name: Smokedetector Check
smokedetector_check.description: Calls test routine of a smoke detector.

entity_id.name: Entity id
entity_id.description: Name of the smoke detector entity.

smokedetector_alarmstate.name: Smokedetector Alarmstate
smokedetector_alarmstate.description: Name of the smoke detector entity to set

entity_id.name: Entity id
entity_id.description: Name of the smoke detector entity.

command.name: Custom command
command.description: Command string to send to the smoke detector.

url.name: URL
url.description: The URL to import the blueprint from.

remove.name: Remove issue 👻
remove.description: Removes a manually created Home Assistant repairs issue. This service can only remove issues created with the `repairs_create` service.

unignore_all.name: Unignore all issues 👻
unignore_all.description: Unignore all issues currently raised in Home Assistant Repairs.

create.name: Create issue 👻
create.description: Manually create and raise a issue in Home Assistant repairs.

description.name: Description
description.description: The description of the issue. Supports Markdown.

issue_id.name: Issue ID
issue_id.description: The issue can have an identifier, which allows you to cancel it later with that ID if needed. It also prevent duplicate issues to be created. If not provided, a random ID will be generated.

domain.name: Domain
domain.description: This field can be used to set the domain of the issue. For example, by default (if not set), it will use "spook". This causes Spook to be shown in the logo/image of the issue. If you set it to "homeassistant", the Home Assistant logo will be used, or use "hue", "zwave_js", "mqtt", etc. to use the logo of that integration.

severity.name: Severity
severity.description: The severity of the issue. This will be used to determine the priority of the issue. If not set, "warning" will be used

persistent.name: Persistent
persistent.description: If the issue should be persistent, which means it will survive restarts of Home Assistant. By default, issues are not persistent.

ignore_all.name: Ignore all issues 👻
ignore_all.description: Ignore all issues currently raised in Home Assistant Repairs.

boo.name: Boo! 👻
boo.description: Calling this service spooks Home Assistant. The service call will always fail.

random_fail.name: Random fail 👻
random_fail.description: A call to this service will randomly fail.

reboot.name: Reboot
reboot.description: Reboots the NAS. This service is deprecated and will be removed in future release. Please use the corresponding button entity.

serial.name: Serial
serial.description: Serial of the NAS to reboot; required when multiple NAS are configured.

shutdown.name: Shutdown
shutdown.description: Shutdowns the NAS. This service is deprecated and will be removed in future release. Please use the corresponding button entity.

serial.name: Serial
serial.description: Serial of the NAS to shutdown; required when multiple NAS are configured.

dev_id.name: Device ID
dev_id.description: ID of the device (find the ID in `known_devices.yaml`).

location_name.name: Location
location_name.description: Name of the location where the device is located. The options are: `home`, `not_home`, or the name of the zone.

gps.name: GPS coordinates
gps.description: GPS coordinates where the device is located, specified by latitude and longitude (for example: [51.513845, -0.100539]).

add_item.name: Add to-do list item
add_item.description: Add a new to-do list item.

item.name: Item name
item.description: The name that represents the to-do item.

due_date.name: Due date
due_date.description: The date the to-do item is expected to be completed.

due_datetime.name: Due date and time
due_datetime.description: The date and time the to-do item is expected to be completed.

description.example: A more complete description of the to-do item than that provided by the summary.
description.name: Description
description.description: A more complete description of the to-do item than provided by the item name.

update_item.name: Update to-do list item
update_item.description: Update an existing to-do list item based on its name.

item.name: Item name
item.description: The name for the to-do list item.

rename.name: Rename item
rename.description: The new name of the to-do item

status.name: Set status
status.description: A status or confirmation of the to-do item.

due_date.name: Due date
due_date.description: The date the to-do item is expected to be completed.

due_datetime.name: Due date and time
due_datetime.description: The date and time the to-do item is expected to be completed.

description.example: A more complete description of the to-do item than that provided by the summary.
description.name: Description
description.description: A more complete description of the to-do item than provided by the item name.

remove_item.name: Remove a to-do list item
remove_item.description: Remove an existing to-do list item by its name.

item.name: Item name
item.description: The name for the to-do list items.

get_items.name: Get to-do list items
get_items.description: Get items on a to-do list.

status.name: Status
status.description: Only return to-do items with the specified statuses. Returns not completed actions by default.

remove_completed_items.name: Remove all completed to-do list items
remove_completed_items.description: Remove all to-do list items that have been completed.

subject.name: Subject
subject.description: The subject of the created event

start.name: Start
start.description: The start time of the event

end.name: End
end.description: The end time of the event

body.name: Body
body.description: The body text for the event (optional)
body.example: Remember to also clean out the gutters

categories.name: Categories
categories.description: list of categories for the event (optional)

sensitivity.name: Sensitivity
sensitivity.description: The sensitivity for the event (optional) [Normal, Personal, Private, Confidential]

show_as.name: Show As
show_as.description: Show event as (optional) [Free, Tentative, Busy, Oof, WorkingElsewhere, Unknown]

is_all_day.name: All Day
is_all_day.description: Set whether event is all day (optional)

attendees.name: Attendees
attendees.description: list of attendees formatted as email: example@example.com type: Required, Optional, or Resource (optional)

modify_calendar_event.name: Modify an event
modify_calendar_event.description: Modify existing calendar event, all properties except event_id are optional.

event_id.name: Event ID
event_id.description: ID for the event, can be found as an attribute on you calendar entity's events

subject.name: Subject
subject.description: The subject of the created event

start.name: Start
start.description: The start time of the event

end.name: End

body.name: Body
body.description: The body text for the event
body.example: Remember to also clean out the gutters

categories.name: Categories
categories.description: list of categories for the event

sensitivity.name: Sensitivity
sensitivity.description: The sensitivity for the event[Normal, Personal, Private, Confidential]

show_as.name: Show As
show_as.description: Show event as [Free, Tentative, Busy, Oof, WorkingElsewhere, Unknown]

is_all_day.name: All Day
is_all_day.description: Set whether event is all day

attendees.name: Attendees
attendees.description: list of attendees formatted as email: example@example.com type: Required, Optional, or Resource

event_id.name: Event ID
event_id.description: ID for the event, can be found as an attribute on you calendar entity's events

event_id.name: Event ID
event_id.description: ID for event, can be found as an attribute on your calendar entity's events

response.name: Response
response.description: The response to the invite [Accept, Tentative, Decline]

message.name: Message
message.description: The response message to the invite (Optional)

send_response.name: Send Response
send_response.description: Send the response to the organizer (Optional)

calendar_id.name: Calendar ID
calendar_id.description: The id of the calendar you want.

summary.name: Summary
summary.description: Acts as the title of the event.

description.name: Description
description.description: The description of the event. Optional.

start_date_time.name: Start time
start_date_time.description: The date and time the event should start.

end_date_time.name: End time
end_date_time.description: The date and time the event should end.

start_date.name: Start date
start_date.description: The date the whole day event should start.

end_date.name: End date
end_date.description: The date the whole day event should end.

in.name: In
in.description: Days or weeks that you want to create the event in.
